transcript.content: 104.9 Xfm. Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington's pressing the buttons.
Noises of Karl pressing the buttons.
Alright.
Ricky laughs.
We're playing some, some great moments from the last three weeks.
And some great records Steve, from the last two weeks.
Steve chuckles.
That's true enough. We're not actually here today.
Uh, what are you up to today, Rick?
Uh, it's 8-hours earlier so um, this is about 2 o'clock, probably.
Mhm.
So it's about 6 o'clock in the morning. I'm still in bed, mate. I'm asleep. In me- in me hotel room.
Now, where are you?
We're in LA
Los Angeles.
Yeah.
City of Angels.
Yeah. Yeah, yeah. Yeah. Yeah.
City of Angels
And so that's what we're doing, we're doing stuff like that. That's why we're not here. We're not here next week either. So, next week is the best of this week.
The Smiths - There Is a Light That Never Goes Out
What?
Ricky laughs whilst playing with a slide whistle.
Someone's left one of those little things in here. It's brilliant, innit?
It's amazing. What are they called those things?
Ricky continues blowing into the whistle.
I just- I imagine- there- just then I was thinking of being in the front row at a Morrissey concert and going "Oi, just- could I just play along.
Ricky blows into the whistle.
Steve chuckles.
They are brilliant.
I don't know what kind of sound that is.
I don't know. It's only used for when Kenneth Williams--
Haha yeah exactly.
Sees someone undressing.
Haha, yeah.
Ricky blows into the whistle.
Haha, yeah.
That's the only time that is used that noise.
Haha, exactly
That is brilliant.
But, it's like it was specially created for the Carry On films.
Yeah, yeah. We need, I don't know what it is, but we need something when I walk in and see someone changing, well, what about this?
Ricky blows into the whistle.
Steve chuckles.
There Is a Light That Never Goes Out by The Smiths. Um, I phoned Karl up in the week. Yeah. And I said, what you doing?

He went: "Well, even though it's one of my days off, I'm just doing some research on the web". I went: "You found anything?". And he said: "Yeah, I'm doing science." and then he said: "You can get wigs for dogs in Tokyo."
Steve chuckles.
That's his scientific fact.
Yeah.
And I went: "What do you mean- dogs if they need a wig?" I said "if they need a wig, what dogs going bald?" and he went like this is fine to him. He went: "It's a stressful City, Tokyo".
Steve laughs.
The world's all right, with Karl. He's always got an explanation.
I've only ever seen him confused once, when in Edinburgh, he looked out of his window one day and he saw a bloke putting a parking ticket on some rubbish.
Yeah.
And that genuinely confused him.
Yeah.
He couldn't work out- could ya?
It's a bit weird, innit?
Ricky laughs.
But- but the thing--
And the ba- and the woman breastfeeding her eight-year-old child. You didn't like did ya?
Nah, I don't like that. But ehm, the whatshername. Animals with wigs. I kind of thought. After I put the phone down to you, I kind of thought about it. I thought, yeah, it is a bit daft, that.
Are you sure it's not the ageing pop group, The Animals?
But when you think, have you ever seen like a bald pet?
No?
It's weird.
Ricky laughs.
What do you mean?
Because me mam, uhm we had a cat- we used to get through loads of cats because we lived on a--
Ricky laughs.
Oh god! He's started early today innit! It's ten past one!
What do you mean you've got through a lot of cats?
What were you doing? Running a restaurant?
Ricky laughs.
Oh god ... what do you mean ?!?
No, we lived on like a main road, right ...
Oh yeah ...
So we used to get through a lot of them.
It was their risk.
Me dad kept saying 'stop wasting money you know with, it's not good'.
Stop wasting money! Not wasting cats!
Right, so, erm, anyway we had this cat that was ill all the time.
Mmm ... he's just a bag of nerves probably!
Yeah! Malingerer! I'm terrified!
I'm going to which house?!?
Ricky makes the sound of a car driving past.
Oh god, bloody 'ell!
Don't let me go to the Pilkington's!
Ricky laughs.
And for some reason it kept being sick all the time.
Ricky laughs.
That is nerves, that's definitely nerves.
So me mam sort of kinda thought 'I've had enough of this' and she shaved it.
WOOOOOOOOOOAH, woah woah woah, now I know you're not vets in your family, but what correlation did your mum think there was between it being sick and shaving it?
Because it kept being sick and it was a pain to wash 'cos it kept getting caught up ...
So she wanted a dry wipe cat.
Why didn't she just varnish it?
Steve chuckles.
What? ... ah ...
It's weird though ...
So now he's cold and sick!
Well not all of it, she left sort of the back half but sort of from it's waist sort of to it's ...
I LOVE that! Shave it 'cos it's sick on itself! It's genius!
It was just the weirdest looking thing, I mean, normally I like cats, I'm always like giving yours a stroke on the 'ead an' that.
Yeah.
As soon as she did that it was like 'ugggh'.
HA! Poor thing!
Can't touch it.
So now it's sick, cold and hated.
Yeah.
I lo ... I ... Karl!
It must've, I mean, the other cats must have been taking the mick out of it constantly. It was just making things worse. Did it get ... I'm hoping that it got run over and was put out of it's misery.
Nah, I think, I think it got alright that one. Or is that the ... ? Yeah it did get run over.
Ricky and Steve laugh.
It did.
Oh god. Oh dear.
How many cats did you say you got through?
I'd say whilst I was living at home, I mean, it's still on the increase even though I'm not there. So whilst I was there ... probably five.
Oh god ...
Wow. And were you upset each time? Or had you just got used to it?
It's one of them things innit, like I've said before, when you first see something it's a bit of a shock, d'you know what I mean? It's like the elephant man or whatever.
Yeah.
First time you see him it's that sort of 'oooooh, look at that'.
D'you remember the first time you saw Steve?
No I'm not being funny, do you remember the first ...
Yeah but I've said this before, it's always ... then you get used to how people look and ...
Ricky cracks up laughing.
... Steve's face ...
I'm gonna burst! I'm ... you're gonna have to play a record!
No, but ...
Because ... you see Steve's face!
Record starts to play
No but I've got used to it.
Shut up ... shut up.
Well, here we are again, Xfm. On a Saturday. Just gone one o'clock Steve. If I'm very much mistaken. But we're not here.
No.
As such, we're away again. Gallivanting, around uh- um- We gotta do the special sort of best of again.
Ok.
Which we did a few weeks ago so this is the best of the last 3 weeks.
Steve chuckles
Um, which I think is- I mean I think it's the best 3 weeks we've ever had. But I'd like it condensed into 2 hours.
Yeah. Yeah, some great music as well in there?
Yeah, there'll be some great
Music. Uh- Uh- Interspersed. With- with fine chat. That you've already heard.
Yeah.
Except this bit, this bit's new. We've actually uh- out of the kindness of our heart we've come in um- we've come in last week.
Yep. Yep.
And we've done a few clips just cos we felt a bit guilty about shooting off and leaving-
I mean I- even now having heard this link I'm beginning to wonder if it was worth our time.
Yeah. Um- Well- Shall we play a classic link?
Lets play- I'd love- What, from the last 3 weeks?
After this, this is 'Feeder'.
Feeder - Just The Way I'm Feeling
Right, if you've just tuned in. It's Xfm 104.9, you've got that bit right. 'Ricky Gervais Show', with me Stephen Merchant.
Hello there.

Karl is actually in a little booth. We're not in the studio you see, we're- this is pre-recorded. We recorded this last week. Cos we're away. And it's sort of like the best-of. Best of the last 3 weeks since last time we were away when we put out the best-of.
It's a long time since we've had any 'White Van Karl'. For those that don't remember this particular hot feature-
Yeah.
Um, we

Basically asks Karl some of the questions that are asked of a white van driver in 'The Sun'. They always have this on Saturday afternoons. Anyway, here's the first one. And they're not fascinating Karl but I'm just interested on your take really.
Yeah.
What do you make of Cilla Black quitting 'Blind Date' after her husband sent a message from beyond the grave. Are you familiar with this story?
I didn't know that. What's- what's that?
Yeah. She went to see a medium and supposedly her husband passed on information through the medium which was incredibly vague
But, um, persuaded her to quit live on air.
Well, so that is about time init. If even dead people are saying-
Ricky laughs
Enough's enough. But I'll tell you what though. Talking about-
Genius.
Talking about ghosts and that. D'ya know how I'm into em.
Yep.
Yeah.
Right, how weird do you think this is? Right.
Well it's not true. Before you say it.
Steve chuckles
Play a record.
No, come on. Go on.
Ricky chuckles
Go on.
Right, it's this woman. I don't even know if it's ghosts really, it's just a bit weird.
Sure.
Yeah. Sure.
There's
This woman-
Yep.
And she's- Well she's not a woman, she's a kid.
Sure.
Steve laughs
Ok.
Sure.

She's walking down like a- a street in her area. It's a nice day and everything. Everything's normal. Um, she's walking down and a woman comes up cycling past. Right. The woman on the bike looks at the kid absolutely terrified.
Exasperated sigh from Ricky
Right.
Got a really scary face on her.
Yeah.
The kid's thinking why- why is she doing that?
Yeah.
Right. So anyway she thinks nothing- nothing of it. Goes- you know I think she was playing in the park or whatever. Goes and has a nice day.
About 15 years later-
Oh right, yeah.
She's... I dunno, I think she was going to work, right, on her bike.
She was riding her own bike. Okay.
Riding her own bike. Cycling down the road.
Oh yeah.
Looks at the kid... that's the thing that happened, like, fifteen/twenty years ago.
Right.
It's her on the bike looking at her as a kid.
Right.
What do ya-
Not- not- not another child?
Nope.
Right.
So it's her, she's seen herself.
Right, I'm- wh- Karl! Wh- wh-
Ricky sighs, Steve laughs
I mean I don't know where to start!
Firstly where's this information come from?

But I mean, wh-why do ever con- I mean, I don't know what part of that you think can be true. I d- I don't- I- I'm hones- I'm- well, I'm speechless. I don't know what to say. What are you talking about?
Steve laughs
Bit, bit weird though, innit?
But it's not true.
It didn't happen, nothing happened like that.
She said it did.
Who?! Who?
Well then she's wrong!
She said she saw herself?
She saw herself as a kid, didn't she.
Did she carry on riding past?
And ah, and as an adult when she was a kid.
Did she stop, and talk to herself? Or did she ride on by and think "That's a bit weird, there's me as an eight-year-old. I won't stop I'll be late for work."
Ricky laughs
Yeah. Yeah, "If I'm late again the boss said he'd be in trouble."
Yeah.
Oh.
Well... well if, you know...
And where is this information- was it- did it happen to someone you know?
Nope.
You overheard it on the bus.
Nah, it was in, uhh, was in the Fortean Times.
Ah right.
Okay. Good. Okay.
Well that's the answer then; we've got to the bottom of that.
Right, good.
Karl, let me ask you now. Umm, Karl you will be a little bit unnerved about this
Have you seen the film Jurassic Park?
Yeah.
You know what happened there?
Yep.

Well, according to this one here, it says 'scientists are planning to clone mammoths for a theme park'. Look at his face! Look at that, he looks like a dog caught in the, the headlights of a car, he's terrified!
I love Karl. I love Karl.
He's sprung to attention there!
I lo- that's- is that- is that the news you could have?
Man-moths?
Ricky and Steve explode with laughter
Right, Karl!
Yeah, Man-moths! Man-moths...
I love the fact that that's why he was so excited, that "they've bred a man-moth!"
"What is- what was this? Yeah, it's- it's a human being that- that hides in you wardrobe and eats an entire jacket in a day."
Yeah. Yeah.
What do you mean 'Man-moths'?! Mammoths! Mammoth, The big hairy cow, from the Ice Age!
Have you heard of a mammoth?
Right...
I mean, elephant.
You're not so excited about that then?
Yeh.
You can take or leave bringing back mammoths to life, but a 'man-moth'?!
A man-moth is a different matter. Ohhhhh.
Steve laughs
If we'd ha- if we'd have never brought that up, he'd have gone and told someone now.
Yeah.
"You know they've bred an 'alf man 'alf moth."
This is what we mean!
And that's ho- that's how things start! You d-
This is what we mean when you read these ghost stories.
You do- Are you slightly deaf? Is that it? When you hear these stories, is it, I-
Is, Karl uh Karl, is English your first language?
Ricky laughs
Are you actually foreign? Is that the thing?
Yeah, yeah.
Do- should we speak slower?
But wh-wh-when we say foreign, we- we mean not of this planet.
Yeah. Should we speak slower, would that be a help to you?
No I, g- d- go on. Next one.
What do you make of that then, seriously...
Do you think that's good? D'you think that's good, too bring back mammoths.
...pre-historic animals.
These giant elephants.
They- they're slow, aren't they? It's not as if they're gonna, like, get and run fast
Can't capture 'em.
There probably would be a fence, to be honest, Karl. There would probably be a fence.
No but i'm say-- but there-- but you're asking it as if like "oh it could all go wrong", but it couldn't, could it?
Well, but the point was about Jurassic Park. Is they thought it wouldn't go wrong, they thought they had it all under control.
Have you learned nothing from Jurassic Park, Karl?
Dinosaurs i'd say oof, think about it before you do it.
Ricky chuckles.
But with a, with a hairy elephant, it's not going to--
It's not a concern for you? Would you go along to see 'em? Would you be interesting in that?
If I was in the area.
Steve and Ricky laugh.
He's the best. He's great, isn't he? I'd love, I'd love a queue, right?
Nothing impresses him.

No, but what I'd like to do is Karl, sitting like Yoda in a little cave and I'd just like to see people like Tony Blair and you know, Stephen Hawking in a queue and they're going to say "Karl got bit of a problem uhm"
Thinking of cloning a man and a moth--
Yeah.
Ricky laughs
Problem?, uh not an issue. Not if I'm in the area, I might cruise around and have a look at it, otherwise just don't send it near my clothes.
Oh, that's fantastic.
So it's just for a second. As the words "man-moth" came into your head, how excited were you?
I mean, were you both terrified and excited? Just for the moment when you thought they'd cloned a man and a moth
I pictured, uhm--
What kind of face did he have? Did he have the moths head, or was it a man's head?
Just a little head, a little man 'ed.
Right, what was his face? What did it look like?
Just, it just was like a bit, a bit like, a bit shocked.
A bit perplexed, yeah.
Ricky laughs
(Whilst laughing) "A bit shocked"
Like so it was like, he'd been he'd been, he'd been grafted onto the body of a moth without his consent?
An' when he was asleep.
Yeah, he'd woken up.
He just, he just went in for a-- to have a goitre removed and they said "we've replaced your goitre the body of a giant moth."
Yeah.
And just--
"Is that alright, Mr. Jenkins?"
And he had the head of a little-- was it a little boy or a man?
Little man.
Right? Okay.
And he's just bumping into a lamp.
Ricky laughs
Just bumping into a lamp?

If you-- Karl, if you went into hospital and they done something or what's the worst thing they could do, right? What would you rather have done to you, right? You wake up and you've got lobster claws for hands.
Alright.
You wake up and you've got ducks feet or you wake up and you've got one horn coming out of your head.
The worst thing?
Yeah.
Probably the uh, the horn coming out of me head.
Ricky giggles.
Why?
It'd get in the way.
That would be useful wouldn't it? In fights and stuff and uh, for like, parties for people to make like (indescernible)
Well I suppose the lobster claws would also be quite handy there.
Ricky laughs.
That's a wonderful, wonderful clip and uh, a great record that preceded or followed it, I'm not sure.
Ricky laughs.
But, uh--
Oh dear.
Could I make some dedications, Rick?
Yeah.
Cause I uh, last week, uh just before we had to come in to record this. Popped out, trying to get onto the tube and I had a nightmare because there were loads-- millions of protesters.
Yeah.
So-called protesters. Now a lot of them obviously doing good work. There was one fella, I think you'd have appreciated it because I know you are very politically active.
Oh.
And I think this guy has really studied hard and he's realised the best way to make his voice heard on the international political stage is to ride around on a tricycle wearing a
A jesters hat.
(chuckling) Ohh!
He was really shaking up the bloody government.
I wouldn't wanna be George W. Bush about now!
(laughing) Not indeed!
Once he sees that I im-
Once he sees that guy...
Imagines his aides rushing in going, (American accent) "Ah, ah George W. um, look at this guy." "Where's that?" "That's in London, England." "Okay, call off the forces."
(American accent) "Is that a large tricycle?"
(laughing) Yeah!
(American accent) "Is he wearing a nappy?"
Ricky laughs
(American accent) "Get me Co-lin Powell." "Why d'you call him 'Co-lin' and not Colin?" (English accent) "It- it's the way he likes it. Don't **** about, just call off the troops, there's a **** in a
Jester's hat, ******* call the troops off!"
Just bleep some of those bits?
Ricky laughs
XFM fade out/in
XFM 104.9, of a Saturday. Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant.
Hello there.
But we're not here. No, we're away, um, so this is the Best Of and, uh, I hope you're enjoying it. Um, we certainly are.
Um, I had some exciting news this week, Karl. You'll be pleased...
Go on.
...to find out. Um, I d- I- I- I'm worried that you might get a bit a little bit jealous cause it's obviously gonna impact on your world quite strongly. 'Cause I know you think-

You like things to quite the- quite sa- you know, same-y, you like the status quo to be maintained. You like the fact that in the past, you know, we've had some cross words, you know, because you f- I remember, what did you think of me when I first walked in? When I first came in on the first day of XFM?
Ye- Yeah but I don't know why you're making a big deal out of it...
D'you wanna bring it- do you wanna mention it?
... cause, I- I'm just being honest though. I'm just being honest.
Well!
I bet a lot of people who see you for the first time sort of go, "Well he's a bit weird."
Ricky laughs
Woahhhh! Woahhh, woahh woah.
I love the fact, Steve, that you brought it up! And then you're- again, y-
But I'm sure that wasn't what he said before!
No he di-
Did he say before I-
Yeah, we- well I-
"He's a bit weird"?
Yeah well I-

He looked at ya, and uh, I knew, I could see by the look on his face. You know when, uh, when you know your- your kid, and your kid's sort of scared of summat, and they go, "Why does you ki-", and he goes, "Oh, he doesn't like pigeons or spiders."
Right.
It was like that. When I saw Karl, and I- I brought you in and I went, "What d'you think of that, Karl?" I could see the look on his face that he di- he was disturbed.
Sure.
And then, as he said, you get used to it, don't ya?
Yeah, you get used to it, and y- you have changed a little bit, your hair's a bit smarter now and you got some nicer glasses and that, I think.
Or I might have just got used to it.
Ricky laughs
Well! Don't
Bring it up, Steve!
Well-
Don't look at me like that!
So you say that you think some other people in the office thought the same? D'you know that for sure...
Karl.
...did you discuss it?
Karl.
Yeah, I think- I think they do, yeah.
Okay leave it there then.
But not just in the office, w- as you walk through the building.
Ricky laughs
I'm stunned.
It's w- it's worse than you ever thought!
I'm stunned- well no, it's not worse than I ever thought because as you well know, Ricky Gervais...
Yeah.
...uh, what did I do on, uhhh, Thursday morning?
Oh is this the thing, uh...
For those, uh, that perhaps are- are not of the female persuasion listening, there's a magazine, apparently it sells quite

Well, it's one of the, sort of, female, you know kind of uh, issues magazines, I think it's called 'Company' magazine. You know, it's like your sort of, I guess it's a bit like your Moor or your Vanity Fair or whatever.
Yeah.
Anyway, they run every year, the '50 most eligible bachelors in Great Britain' section. Ding dong, hello! Who's in there this year? In the fi- in the fifty? In the top fifty of the entire country?
And then they vote, they vote and they put 'em in order and see who- who's the most eligible bachelor, innit.
But that's of- that's 50 people, right? Most- I'm in the- I... it always annoys me slightly because
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
I don't know what you tell these people. I mean- you don't get their permission, to play this out, do you?
The thing is- right- yeah, I sort of told him what it was about but we won't say who he is or where he works because it doesn't matter. I just needed to speak to someone who knows.
I love the fact that you were trying to get an answer out of him by suggesting that he would be safe because he can look after jellyfish, if he gave the okay to destroy snails!
(Laughing) He was getting livid, you can tell.
Oh God, brilliant. So they've been around a long time but what have they done? Well..
Right last week when I did "Do we need 'em?" Erm... D'you know when I called up erm... one of the Museums didn't I? Science museum.
Yeah, you talking to me?
Yeah. I'm just saying I wanted to tell you before when the song was on but you were so busy listening to it...
Ye- Oh! Oh! Oh! Was I?! So busy listening to a song I was playing?!
Yeah, but we're doing a radio show aren't we?
All right, what's your point?
I just wanted to say she emailed into to say I got her name wrong so I'm just apologizing for that.
What did you just call her?
I think I called her Jessica.
What was her name?
I don't know, I've got it on email somewhere...
Well s-
This is not an apology!
You've got it wrong again!
You've not even said her real name, how is that an apology?
Well I remember, I read the email, So I- yeah I-
Who are you apologizing to?
I think her name's Jackie. I think.
Oh, you've got it wrong again haven't you.
Well... Well anyway, she just said, if you, you know, if you want to see dinosaurs and that go to the museum.
You were complaining about that as well, weren't you? You went to a museum and there was too many dinosaurs,
You just said, he said you just need four.
Steve laughs.
No, but Steve, have you been to the one at- in Knightsbridge?
I think so.

This is the one that I called up, right? It's nice. You go in, you get a good collection of stuff. You walk in, there's three or four dinosaurs. You've had enough. Alright? Go to- I went to New York, right? Went to the museum there. Hundreds of them. You can't move for dinosaurs. It's almost like- they're responsible for them being extinct. All I'm saying is, if you want to see a dinosaur, go to the
One near Knightsbridge, they've got a nice selection, some old vases and stuff, it's worth going, so...
That was great Karl. Play a record. Well done.
Bit of uh, bit of Amy Mann?
Aww, I'm obsessed with this song. Red Vines. It's... It's brilliant.

XFM 104.9, Ricky Gervais show with uh, Steve Merchant, hello there. And we're not here this week. We're off jetting around the world, so we pre-recorded these links and the time is currently somewhere between
One and three o'clock.
So uh, a time check there from Steve Merchant.
No problem.
Yeah. And uh... Oh, what- what about this weather? Um, Isn't it warm, stroke - edit that Karl - cold? Okay? Whichever one. Umm...
I'm pleased to see that the congestion charge has... had some considerable effect. Had no effect.
So just... yeah. Wasn't that great on telly last night, the film?
Yeah. I particularly enjoyed last night's EastEnders. Coronation Street. Brookside.
Okay?
Yeah.
Ricky laughs.
Steve laughs.
XFM
XFM 104.9, Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Tell us about this monkey Karl.
You're going to love this one Steve, All right? Yeah. So last week we were talking about how- like- a lad left his family because there's
There was problems at home, and that: he went and lived in the wood - he got hairy, right?
No.
Leave it there Rick, we haven’t got time to go into it. So that's what happened.
And that's what happened. He lived with the monkeys and he got hairy.
Ugh, no
That’s what happened.
Looked into some other stuff about, like, hairy kids and all that -
Yes, Yeah
Haha
- came across this story about a bloke, ‘right, who worked in a zoo.
Oh dear.
Right. So uh -
Troubles brewing.
- loving his job an’ that, but it's quite a lonely sort a job because you don't see many people, you’re  just dealing with animals all the time.
So anyway, he gets a bit pally with a monkey because it's the closest thing to a human.
Well, an ape is…
Yeah, but you can't really go that close to apes, ‘cause they’re dangerous.
Well, what do you mean, what type was it, do you mean it was a chimp?
Just let him tell the story.
Was it a chimpanzee?
I reckon it was a chimp. Yeah. Yeah. It was a chimp.
You don't even know. So that's an ape.
Yeah. But it doesn't matter does it, it’s the story.
So he gets pally with him.
So he gets pally with him -
What, do they go on holiday together?
Well, no, I mean, it starts off -
On the pull together.
- starts off just checking each other out and, you know, probably sharing lunch and that together.
Yeah.

Right, anyway, this goes on for a while, he’s uh, you know, they're getting on well an’ that. And then after a while, right, the monkey starts sort of imitating him a bit more and sort of walking upright.
Oh, God.
Yeah, yeah.
Right. So he thinks, “Oh, that's a bit weird.” Anyway, so they get on really better and what have you. So he thinks it could, it could live at home, with me, this.
Yeah
‘Cause we're getting on a storm.
Yeah.
So he takes him home and before you know it -
Is this the beginning of “Beneath the Planet of the Apes”? I think it is, I think you've seen this on video.
I worried because he's already imitating him and their moving in together, I'm thinking it’s maybe a bit like “Single White Female”.
Ricky Laughs
Single White Zookeeper
Brilliant, go on.
